data.title: Love Actually Cast Invites You to Guess Who Aged the Best in Sequel Teaser
data.meta_description: The cast got together for a cue-card-style trailer for its upcoming Red Nose Day reunion.
data.text:
The cast of Love Actually is bringing back that famous cue-card scene. In a new teaser for its upcoming Red Nose Day reunion sequel, everyone from Andrew Lincoln to Keira Knightley to Liam Neeson gets in on the cue-card action for a delightful promo that makes a rather saucy proposition.

A card held by Lúcia Moniz, who plays Colin Firth’s love interest in the original film, invites fans to “tune in to see what happened to everyone.”

“And, amongst other things, which one of us has aged best,” reads Keira Knightley’s card. The actress ever so slightly raises her brow after unveiling the card, as if to suggest there is only one true answer. That’s fine by co-star Hugh Grant, whose cue-card demands that fans say that “it’s not Colin Firth.”

The teaser also features appearances by Rowan Atkinson, Bill Nighy, and Chiwetel Ejiofor, who plays Knightley’s husband in the original 2003 film.

Knightley’s character, Juliet, by the way, was the original subject of the infamous cue-card scene . . . which is pretty messed up if you think about it for approximately two seconds! Even though Mark and Peter (Ejiofor) were supposed to be best friends, all along, Mark was scheming up ways to sweep Juliet off her feet. Will the duo possibly end up together in the reunion? According to new details from producer Emma Freund, Mark “still loves her” after all these years, so anything’s possible. Here’s hoping Peter finds out the truth and exacts his revenge in the upcoming reunion, which is set to air on May 25.

The short premieres March 24 in the U.K. and May 25 in the U.S.
